member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_PhoneSamples.App
member.summary: Provides application-specific behavior to supplement the default Application class.

member.name: M:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_PhoneSamples.App.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes the singleton application object. This is the first line of authored code executed, and as such is the logical equivalent of main() or WinMain().

member.name: F:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_PhoneSamples.App._continuationManager
member.summary: For handling FileOpenPicker.PickSingleFileAndContinue Reference: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/apps/xaml/dn614994.aspx

member.name: M:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_PhoneSamples.App.OnLaunched(Windows.ApplicationModel.Activation.LaunchActivatedEventArgs)
member.summary: Invoked when the application is launched normally by the end user. Other entry points will be used when the application is launched to open a specific file, to display search results, and so forth.
member.param: Details about the launch request and process.

member.name: M:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_PhoneSamples.App.RootFrame_FirstNavigated(System.Object,Windows.UI.Xaml.Navigation.NavigationEventArgs)
member.summary: Restores the content transitions after the app has launched.
member.param: The object where the handler is attached.

member.name: M:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_PhoneSamples.App.OnSuspending(System.Object,Windows.ApplicationModel.SuspendingEventArgs)
member.summary: Invoked when application execution is being suspended. Application state is saved without knowing whether the application will be terminated or resumed with the contents of memory still intact.
member.param: The source of the suspend request.

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_PhoneSamples.Samples.SOEElevationData
member.summary: This sample demonstrates how to use a custom Server Object Extension (SOE) hosted by ArcGIS for Server. The SOE operation used in this example returns a set of interpolated elevation values for a user defined grid. The grid extent and number of rows and columns are provided as inputs to the SOE.
member.title: SOE Elevation Data

member.summary: This sample demonstrates how to calculate the area and perimeter of a polygon using the GeometryEngine.

member.summary: Demonstrates the GeometryEngine.Boundary method to calculate the geometric boundary of a given geometry.

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_PhoneSamples.Samples.BufferPoint
member.summary: This sample demonstrates the use of the GeometryEngine to calculate a buffer.

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_PhoneSamples.Samples.ConvexHull
member.summary: This sample demonstrates use of the GeometryEngine.ConvexHull method to create a convex hull polygon for three or more points. A convex hull is the smallest polygon that completely encases a set of points.
member.title: Convex Hull

member.name: M:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_PhoneSamples.Samples.ConvexHull.#ctor
member.summary: Construct Convex Hull sample control

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_PhoneSamples.Samples.CreatePoints
member.summary: This sample demonstrates how to create point geometries, attach them to graphics and display them on the map. MapPoint geometry objects are used to store geographic points.
member.title: Create Points

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_PhoneSamples.Samples.CreatePolygons
member.summary: This sample demonstrates how to create polygon geometries, attach them to graphics, and display them on the map. Polygon geometry objects are used to store geographic polygons.
member.title: Create Polygons

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_PhoneSamples.Samples.CreatePolylines
member.summary: This sample demonstrates how to create polyline geometries, attach them to graphics, and display them on the map. Polyline geometry objects are used to store geographic lines.
member.title: Create Polylines

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_PhoneSamples.Samples.CutPolygons
member.summary: This sample demonstrates using the GeometryEngine.Cut method to cut feature geometries with a given polyline.
member.title: Cut

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_PhoneSamples.Samples.DensifyPolygons
member.summary: This sample demonstrates using GeometryEngine.Densify to take an input polygon and return a densified polygon.
member.title: Densify

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_PhoneSamples.Samples.Difference
member.summary: This sample demonstrates using the GeometryEngine.Difference or GeometryEngine.SymmetricDifference methods to calculate the geometric difference between feature geometries and a user defined geometry.
member.title: Difference

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_PhoneSamples.Samples.Distance
member.summary: This sample demonstrates using the GeometryEngine.DistanceFromGeometry method to calculate the linear distance of the shortest length between two geometries.
member.title: Distance From Geometry

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_PhoneSamples.Samples.Generalize
member.summary: This sample demonstrates using the GeometryEngine.Generalize method to take a polyline with numerous vertices and return a generalized polyline with fewer vertices.
member.title: Generalize

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_PhoneSamples.Samples.GeodesicBuffer
member.summary: This sample demonstrates use of the GeometryEngine to calculate a geodesic buffer.

member.summary: This sample demonstrates using GeometryEngine.GeodesicDensify to take an input shape and return a geodesic densified shape.

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_PhoneSamples.Samples.PopulationForArea
member.summary: This sample uses a geoprocessing task to estimate the number of people within a polygon you draw on the map. Click 'Summarize Population', then freehand a line on the map surrounding an area to analyze. When you release the mouse button, the polygon will auto-complete and you'll see how many people are estimated to live within the polygon boundaries.

member.name: M:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_PhoneSamples.Samples.OAuthAuthorizeHandler.DecodeParameters(System.Uri)

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_PhoneSamples.Samples.DriveTimes
member.summary: This sample demonstrates use of the Geoprocessor to call a DriveTimes geoprocessing service. To use the sample, click a point in the map. Drive time polygons of 1, 2, and 3 minutes will be calculated and displayed on the map.
member.title: Drive Times

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_PhoneSamples.Samples.MessageInABottle
member.summary: This sample demonstrates use of the Geoprocessor to call a MessageInABottle geoprocessing service. To use the sample, specify the number of days and click a point in the ocean. The path of a bottle dropped at the click point over the specified number of days will be drawn on the map.
member.title: Message in a Bottle

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_PhoneSamples.Samples.RandomProvider
member.summary: This is serves as a custom location provider - in this case creating a randomly roaming location for simulating movement, accuracy, speed and heading changes.

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_PhoneSamples.Samples.ShowMapExtent
member.summary: This sample demonstrates the ExtentChanged event on the MapView and display extent properties at runtime. Since the Map is in wrap-around mode, absolute values represent the map extent on an infinite continuous grid where values on the X axis increase or decrease as you pan. Normalized values represent the map extent in the real-world and take the dateline (or current central meridian) into account.
member.title: Show Map Extent

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_PhoneSamples.Samples.OverviewMap
member.summary: This sample demonstrates displaying an overview map to indicate the extent of the parent map.
member.title: Overview Map
